inclusion.criterion: treatment or prevention of a medical condition or malignancy expected to result in permanent and complete loss of subsequent ovarian function
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: have a medical condition or malignancy that requires removal of all or part of one or both ovaries
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: participant undergoing elective removal of an ovary for fertility preservation only must have two ovaries
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: participant who already has stored cryopreserved ovarian tissue in a frozen state prior to undergoing cancer treatments (surgery, chemotherapy or radiation) will be eligible for enrollment with informed consent
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: is not a candidate for or chooses not to utilize embryo or oocyte banking
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: psychological, psychiatric or other conditions which prevent giving fully informed consent
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: underlying medical condition which significantly increases risk of complications from anesthesia and surgery
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: participants with a large cancerous mass in the ovary that is being removed; cryopreservation will not be performed on portions of the ovary
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: blood testing indicates that the participant does not have enough eggs remaining in her ovary
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient is a 19-year-old Hispanic female with mild headache and leg swelling. She has hypertension (BP 146/99) and proteinuria (3+ proteins on urine dipstick). Her physical exam was negative for abdominal pain, change in bowel habits, nausea, vomiting, dysuria, frequency, hematuria or frothy urine.
